content: this design was created and produced in collaboration with jeny staiman 1 listen to the backstory of this pattern in this episode 6 the story of kvetching starts about halfway through thanks knitsibs --jeny and brenda kvetching fingerless mitts are a pattern mash-up of two great knitty com designs by two wonderful designers fetching 7 by cheryl niamath and knucks 8 by pam grossman both of these patterns debuted in knitty com in the summer of 2006 9 like fetching kvetching features an elegant cabled cuff a ribbed hand and a sweet cabled detail at the fingertips like knucks the mitts are worked from fingers to cuff and feature a provisionally cast on thumb gusset to complete the design we hid a purl column inside the cables at the fingertips and wrist to help control flare and we devised a foolproof method for closing holes at the sides of the thumb gusset like their inspirations kvetching mitts are quick to knit make great gifts and provide an excellent introduction to working simple cables and provisional stitches *sincere thanks and admiration to cheryl niamath 10 and pam grossman 11 for your creative minds and generous spirits * 1 https //www ravelry com/designers/jeny-staiman 2 https //www brendadayne co uk/ 3 https //www ravelry com/redeem/tidy-press 4 https //www ravelry com/designers/brenda-dayne 5 https //www ravelry com/designers/jeny-staiman 6 https //www brendadayne co uk/2023/03/11/188-the-road-trip/ 7 https //knitty com/issuesummer06/pattfetching html 8 https //knitty com/issuesummer06/pattknucks html 9 https //knitty com/issuesummer06/index html 10 https //www ravelry com/designers/cheryl-niamath 11 https //www ravelry com/designers/pamela-grossman
